summary: This document is a chain of emails from April 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing preparation of an update memo on the Epstein case. The emails reference coordination on the memo, a CVRA suit, Florida victims litigation, and a request for the first name/last initial of 'Victim-3'.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein case update memo
events.description: USANYS personnel exchange emails to coordinate the preparation of an update memo on the Epstein case for an upcoming meeting, discussing content, edits, and victim information.

events.title: Scheduled meeting on Epstein case
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Monday, April 29, 2019, to discuss the Epstein case, prompting the request for the update memo.

keyFacts: The emails are internal communications within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding the Epstein case.
Personnel are preparing an update memo on the case's status, actions taken since the last update, and next steps for an upcoming meeting.
The correspondence references a CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) suit and Florida victims litigation related to the case.
A specific request is made for the first name and last initial of 'Victim-3', indicating ongoing victim identification work.
The document shows internal DOJ coordination and preparation for high-level briefings on the Epstein investigation in April 2019.
